description:
Cercocebus atys, commonly known as the sooty mangabey, is a species of Old World monkey native to West Africa. It belongs to the genus Cercocebus, which is part of the subfamily Cercopithecinae.

The sooty mangabey is a medium-sized primate, typically weighing between 5 to 15 kilograms. It has a distinctive black or dark gray fur coat, which gives it its common name. The species has a rounded head, a short muzzle, and a distinctive white ring around the eyes and mouth, which helps with visual communication.

Sooty mangabeys are primarily arboreal, spending most of their time in the canopy of tropical forests and woodlands. They are omnivorous, feeding on a variety of plant matter, including fruits, leaves, seeds, and insects. The species is known for its complex social behavior, living in large, multi-male, multi-female groups with a complex dominance hierarchy.

Cercocebus atys is classified as Vulnerable on the IUCN Red List of Threatened Species, primarily due to habitat loss and fragmentation. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this species and its natural habitat in West Africa.
